column1: EVTDESC13000;"In 1665 Charles II became the King of Spain; suffering from ill-health all his life
column2: his death was anticipated almost from birth. It soon became apparent that the Spanish Habsburg line would die with him. As a result
column3: his succession was hotly debated for decades. In 1670
column4: England agreed to support the rights of Louis XIV to the Spanish throne in the Treaty of Dover
column5: while the terms of the 1688 Grand Alliance committed England and the Dutch Republic to back Leopold from the house of Habsburg. In 1700
column6: the Spanish Empire includes possessions in Italy
column8: the Philippines and the Americas and though no longer the dominant great power
column9: it remaines largely intact. Its acquisition by either the Austrian Habsburgs or French Bourbons would change the balance of power in Europe
column10: and so its inheritance may lead to a war that involves most of the European powers.";;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTNAME13007;The Spaniards Have chosen a Bourbon heir;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: it may shake the delicate balance of power
